greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle by rows relating to the factorials, generated from A002260.
comment: Left border = the factorials, A000142 prefaced with a 1.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
example: First few rows of the triangle =
maple: T:= proc(n) option remember; local M, k;
mathematica: T[n_] := T[n] = Module[{M}, M = Table[If[i == j, 1, If[i>j, j*(-1)^(i+j), 0]], {i, 1, n+1}, {j, 1, n+1}] // Inverse; M[[n+1]]]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 14}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 09 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Feb 22 2012
